alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Canyon Ferry Area; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Fergus County below 4500ft; Gallatin Valley; Gates of the Mountains; Helena Valley; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Madison River Valley; Meagher County Valleys; Missouri Headwaters; Northern Blaine County; Northern High Plains; Northwest Beaverhead County; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Southern High Plains; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 3:30AM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph, at times. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and southwest Montana. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they have appropriate knowledge and gear and may want to consider alternate plans. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow may significantly reduce visibility, at times.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
